text.p: Swedish appliance maker Electrolux was expected to post a fall in profits after financial items for 1996 to 3.49 billion crowns compared to 4.02 billion crowns a year earlier, a Reuter poll found.
Forecasts from 12 analysts for the full year result varied between 3.09 billion crowns and 3.86 billion crowns.
Despite the expected drop in profits, the company's dividend was expected to increase to 12.80 crowns per share from 12.50 crowns in 1995. Forecasts ranged from 12.5 to 14.0 crowns.
But analysts saw the profit fall in 1996 as temporary.
In 1997, profit after financial items was expected to rise to 4.34 billion crowns and in 1998 to 5.08 billion crowns.

Analysts interviewed for the survey were from Carnegie, Den Danske Bank, Erik Penser, Fiba, Handelsbanken, Myrberg & Wiklund, Nordiska, James Capel, Morgan Grenfell, Swedbank, Swiss Bank, and Unibank.
Electrolux will release its full year results today around
